comments:
Build: 3.2 RC4

I got this exception today on stdout (not in the log file).  It looks like the SWTException should just be caught and handled in this case (even if you call isDisposed beforehand, it may become disposed before you can call Widget.getDisplay).

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3374)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3297)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3268)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:435)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.getDisplay(Widget.java:545)
        at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.ResourceListSelectionDialog$UpdateGatherThread.run(ResourceListSelectionDialog.java:250)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3374)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.getDisplay(Widget.java:545)
        at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.ResourceListSelectionDialog$UpdateGatherThread.run(ResourceListSelectionDialog.java:250)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3297)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3268)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:435)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.getDisplay(Widget.java:545)
        at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.ResourceListSelectionDialog$UpdateGatherThread.run(ResourceListSelectionDialog.java:250)

John, was anything unique going on when you saw this occur?  
Or did you notice after the fact?

I only noticed it after the fact. Likely not something to worry about for 3.2. I wonder if it's similar to bug 26392 - canceling the dialog quickly after opening.  However, I haven't been able to reproduce it.

moving Open Resource related bugs to Szymon.
Szymon, please move between you and Krystof as needed.  Let me know if you have any questions.  These are all the bugs I had related to OpenResource.

Inspite of changing the dialogs implementations, the problem remained.
It was fixed in I20061121-1845.
